page.title: 16DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ADULT
page.content: his morning,funny,he enjoyed everything he did,but won't admit that he likes school. Time to make beds and put the hoover on,then some painting. The boys persuaded us to give them separate bedrooms, which means a general rearrangement upstairs and lots of decorating-which I thoroughly enjoy. Time for coffee with a neighbour (not a bad life) while David plays with his friends before picking Matthew up from school. Tea for the boys passes quickly then off out to play, washing up and ironing for me,not all work though - some tennis with the boys as well. Geoff arrives home early,after dinner he suggests we meet some friends in the local pub,a pleasant change from an evening in front of the television. As usual the party continues at our home until midnight.Everyone leaves and we..
